data.title: Such a disappointment
data.text: The first time I went to Jimmy's it was wonderful and I bragged to my daughter about the food. Well I finally got to take her today (10/8/16) and it was terrible. She got the Baked Spaghetti and what she got resembled a pile of over cooked, gummy noodles, dried out mashed tomatoes, red water (that laid in the bottom of the plate) and melted cheese on top. When I asked about this the owner offered to "drain the water off the plate". That was it...nothing else to make it better. The cook was the only one who offered to remake it for her. Then for the "slap in the face" I had to pay $35.00 for the meal...no discount...didn't even offer to remove the spaghetti from my bill. That is the last time I will ever go there again.

data.title: Not jus' pizza
data.text: This is a fine pizza place...they have been making them for YEARS!!! But you can get a lunch plate or salad at lunch for really great prices. They have everyday specials w/all types of food choices {Greek, American, Italian}. The owners & wait staff are always fast and friendly! The food is tasty at a reasonable cost.

data.title: Good for what it is..
data.text: This is just like many other small, old, Italian/pizza joints. Older woman barking orders at young waitresses. Huge plate of spaghetti and meatballs with garlic bread for eight bucks. They were also accommodating with the fact I was in a hurry because I was catching a train a couple blocks away.

data.title: Excellent baked spaghetti!!
data.text: This restaurant is a small place that you might overlook if you were just driving by. The servers are very friendly and the food is awesome!!

data.title: Great place for lunch or dinner
data.text: Had a tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwich that was like mom made. The waitresses are always friendly and take care of me.  They definitely keep the drinks full. Selection of food is good.  I really recommend the lasagna with baked cheese.

data.title: Moto Bueno!!!
data.text:
Great home cooked family receipes that keep on pleasing us!!!!
Zito is grand & so is chicken picata!!
The staff is friendly & want to please!!
Love that it is " little & local"!

data.title: Great Eats!!
data.text: My mother was a waitress there when I was a little girl in the 70's. Now, I take my children there and we love it.  It brings back memories and create new memories. My children and I have our favorite dishes but we like to share with each other.

data.title: Good home cooking, more than just Pizza
data.text: Went for lunch and was surprised that they offered meat & vegetable plates + Pizza. Lunch was very good, vegetables were home cooked and very good. Blue plate lunch comes with dessert, on that day it was Cherry Cobbler. The Cobbler was good but very sweet. Overall a great place for the value. I Did not get the baked spaghetti but it looked great and could easily be split for a couple, the portion looked large.

data.title: Local, good value place
data.text: Typical local restaurant, offering excellent value food. Lunch menu of main course with choice of vegetable, small dessert, roll and butter, coffee/water/iced tea. We had liver and onions, with mash potato and turnip greens and gravy....delicious.

data.title: Not just another pizza place, much more than pizza.
data.text: I would not consider this to be a pizza place.  Yes, they offer pizza and other Italian dishes, but at least during lunch the meat + 2 is what I see most folks eating.  I have eaten here twice this week for lunch while in town on business and on both occasions it was good and fast with friendly service.  Baked chicken with rice was good and today the grilled chicken was good.  On both visits I was able to have a satisfying lunch in less than 30 minutes for under $7, drink and dessert included, before tip.  It is getting harder and harder to find quality food, with friendly service at this price.  If I lived in the area and worked downtown, or nearby, I'd be a regular at this place.

data.title: NOT THE SAME PEOPLE
data.text: The name may be the same, but that is it.  This place used to rock some serious baked spaghetti.  Now the sauce tastes like it came from a can and service is well... The main guy working the place isn't there anymore, he was always super cool and seemed to be in a good mood.  This place was a superstar for HP. Now, much like the rest of the town, it is in shambles.  Hopefully that guy will come out with another restaurant.  I'd drive an hour to get that baked spaghetti again.  So long Jimmy's, good bye forever

data.title: Good all around choice for spaghetti and pizza
data.text: My wife and I started coming here when we we first started our married life together, food was good, didn't cost a lot, we were always well fed. The tea is always good, staff friendly, food is always delicious!

data.title: Quick lunch
data.text:
This is a local restaurant been here since early 70s nothing fancy but quick decent food and fair price
Pizza are good lots toppings to chose from

data.title: A Real Treat in Downtown High Point!
data.text:
With the exception of my four years in college, I have lived in High Point all my life.  I have known about Jimmy's Pizza for decades but have never eaten there.  I have been saying lately when we come through downtown, that we need to stop and try it out.  I have heard so many good things.  Tonight my wife and I and my 23 year old son ate at Jimmy's.  Very, very good!  First of all, I don't eat any Italian and am very picky,  The have several items on the menu for those kids or picky adults who don't want Italian.  I had a double cheeseburger plain with cheese only.  Since I am picky, I eat them plain.  It tasted very similar to the burger I get a Five Guys, which is excellent.  I also had a generous portion of fries, all for $4.95.  My wife got the lasagna, and it looked authentic and wonderful.  She loves Italian and said this was some of the best she has had.  She ate about half and said, "I really can't eat any more right now but I really want to."  I looked a few minutes later and she had almost finished the rest of it.  My 23 year old ordered Tortelinni, and it looked just as good.  He thought it was wonderful and it was also a large portion.  
Another clue that this restaurant serves excellent food?  We were there at 7pm on a dark, cold Friday night in downtown High Point, which is deserted on winter nights.  As we walked in, we had to wait on a table and there was a line of locals waiting almost the whole time we ate.
The lasagna and tortellini were both under $8 and I think you can share a plate for 50 cents.  
The restaurant is not large and roomy, but cozy and has the feel of a family diner.  There are booths available for 4 people and 2 people, but nothing for larger groups.  There are also about  10 stools at the front if you prefer to sit at the front counter and eat.   We all agreed that we will be coming back on a regular basis.  If you get the chance, try it out!

data.title: Decent food. Friendly folk.
data.text: I eat here regularly because I like the atmosphere. It's warm and friendly. I've traveled the world and eaten at hundreds of restaurants, and this food isn't really anything to write home about. The prices are very reasonable. My favorite dish is the baked spaghetti and you get tons of it.

data.title: Great food great price
data.text: I have been eating the spaghetti ala Venice for 20+ years and it is consistently delicious!  I enjoy the relaxed friendly service - the staff always make us feel welcome.

data.title: Mom & Pop with big town taste
data.text: I lived in High Point for 10 years before trying it - and wish I hadn't waited so long. Definitely worth stopping in.

data.title: Great traditional restaurant in High Point - great food, and reasonable
data.text:
Since 1972 this restaurant has been providing excellent food at very fair prices, right in downtown High Point.  Wide array of choices (see menu below).  Very popular with locals and travelers alike, including visitors to the High Point furniture market.  Service is courteous and prompt.  Hurry on down. 
http://www.jimmyspizzahouse.com/ordereze/Menu/Menus.aspx

data.title: Great food and service.
data.text: The name is Jimmy's Pizza but they have a little of everything on the menu.  You can tell how good a place is by the locals.  The staff seemed to know about everyone that came in.  We really enjoyed the food and service.  We will definitely be back on our next visit.

data.title: Great store front restaurant,don't judge book by cover.
data.text: They have daily specials 5-6 of them 5.95 and I've had several of them all good.You have check this out for yourself,you won't be sorry and great friendly staff.
